user\_id=1596389
Originator: NO

Gerhard & Cecelia:

This ticket bothers me b/c it represents an issue we shall be dealing with more and more.  WRF released a version of the their model that included a very limited ESMF capability.  A third-party user tried to used WRF and ESMF beyond these limited capabilities.  They end up contacting us, we end up opening a ticket and contacting the original model developers.  They tell us, tough beans, the user is going to have to wait for another more advanced version of the model.  This may not happen for a long, long, long time.  So, philosophically, do we:

a\) leave the ticket open until the model developers get around to upgrading their model \(could be AGES\).
this impacts our metrics by leaving open a ticket that we have no control over. If we go this route, I suggest we create a new key to indicate this is out of our hands e.g. EMBED\_ESMF: Waiting on others or some such.

b\) if there is no clear indication that the issue is going to be fixed in a timely manner \(say 6 months or less\) which I suspect will often be the case, then close the ticket.  I suspect the user is not going to hang around and wait for the original model developers given their needs.  It is also possible that the public distribution is a dead end \(e.g. CICE\) and the original developers have no intention of upgrading or changing their ESMF implementation.


What are your thoughts?


Sylvia

tickets.description:
WHO: Thomas Loridan from the Barcelona Supercomputing Center

Hello,

I am having problem with version 3\_0\_1 of the ESMF library. I need to use this version and not a newer one because the model I need to run \(UMO\) uses it. We are working on an IBM Power PC with Linux SuSe Distribution 
and IBM compiler xlf. The Model seems to riun just fine but never writes out anything, and when looking into the code we realized that it was never entering the call to 

CALL ESMF\_GridCompRun\(atm\_int\_state%WRT\_COMPS\(J\)...\)

where WRT\_COMPS is the writting component. When replacing this call by the actual writting part of the routine we get an error saying 

WARNING: No Import ESMF quantities for the Write Component

And when asking people who designed he code they replied:
\---------------------------------------------------------------------
My feeling is that this is an ESMF problem.  Something may be going 
wrong when ESMF stows away the pointer to WRT\_RUN during the call to 
ESMF\_GridCompSetEntryPoint\(\) \(via ESMF\_GridCompSetServices\(\)\).

The only difference between the write component and the others is that there can be more than one of them.  So, the call to 
ESMF\_GridCompSetServices\(\) is made repeatedly for WRITE\_REGISTER:

DO I=1,WRITE\_GROUPS
CALL ESMF\_GridCompSetServices\(atm\_int\_state%WRT\_COMPS\(I\)  &  
\!<-- The read followed by the write gridded components
,WRITE\_REGISTER  &  \!<-- The user's 
subroutine name
,IRC\)
ENDDO

This should work just fine.  ESMF core team should be able to help.
\----------------------------------------------------------------------

Would you have any idea of how to fix tha?

Many thanks

Thomas

Description:
Dan,
The crash is coming from function ESMF\_StateCreate in file
esmf/src//Superstructure/State/src/ESMF\_State.F90. Just to let you know in case something was done with this function in your previous build. Still digging...
Hamid

Current Assignees: Applications Team

System:	 Other

Problem Type:	 Other

We are trying to use ESMF v 2\_2\_0rp2 on palm \(SGI Altix\). We are building both ESMF and GEOSGCM with Intel compiler v.10.0.025. The ESMF build options are

ESMF\_COMPILER: intel
ESMF\_BOPT: g
ESMF\_PREC: 64

tickets.description:
WHO: Heidar Thor Thrastarson from the University of London


Hello,

I'm using the Community Atmosphere Model \(CAM\), including the ESMF distribution that comes with it \(ESMC\_VERSION\_NUMBER "MF Version 0.0.1, Released Apr. 9, 2001"\). Now I am trying without success to get the model working on a Mac OS X \(see details below\) with an Absoft compiler \(Pro Fortran 9.2\) and I think my problems are related to the ESMF library.

When I try to build CAM with gnumake, including building the ESMF library, I get a message in make.out saying:

ranlib: file:
/Users/heidar/CAM3/work/4defaultcase/bld/esmf/lib/libO/Darwin\_absoft/libesmf.a\(ESMF\_BasicUtilMod.o\)
has no symbols

Also I get similar messages for other files that should be included in
libesmf.a. Later, the build will fail when the library is needed.

Can anyone help me with this? Any experience from other people trying the same?

I include with this mail the make.out file, resulting from trying to build CAM. That file includes info from base\_variables, ESMF\_conf.h, and other specific files for building ESMF with Darwin/Absoft, that are included
with the CAM distribution. I guess I might have to modify some flags set in these files. Any ideas on that?

My platform:
\(uname -a
Darwin chostar.maths.qmul.ac.uk 8.10.0 Darwin Kernel Version 8.10.0: Wed
May 23 16:50:59 PDT 2007; root:xnu-792.21.3~1/RELEASE\_PPC Power Macintosh
powerpc\).

Please let me know if you need more info.

Fast response would be appreciated\!

With best regards,

Heidar Thor Thrastarson,
PhD student,
Queen Mary, University of London, Astronomy Unit.

tickets.description:
WHO: Jules Kouatchou from NASA


Gerhard,

I hope you are doing well.
If you do not mind, I want to ask you a question on ESMF.
I want to write an ESMF application that has the following features:

\- "n+1" PEs are available
\- the initialize/run/finalize methods use "n" PEs only

Operations within initialize/run/finalize methods should be performed on "n" PEs but my code crashes because "n+1" PEs are involved. My guess is that the child VM is not properly initialized. For instance, when I do inside the initialize method:

call ESMF\_VMGetCurrent\(vm, RC=STATUS \)
VERIFY\_\(STATUS\)
call ESMF\_VMGet\(vm, PetCount=numPEs, RC=STATUS \)
VERIFY\_\(STATUS\)

numPEs = n+1 but not n \(as I want\). Down the road, the call

call ESMF\_VMBarrier\(vm, rc=rc\)

causes the code to freeze because "n+1" PEs are expected when in fact "n" PEs only can reach the call.

Here is my initial setup:

workerLayout = ESMF\_DELayoutCreate\(vm, deCountList=\(/NX, NY/\), &
& petList=petList, rc=status\)
VERIFY\_\(STATUS\)

.........

call ESMF\_GridDistribute\(grid, deLayout=workerLayout, &
& countsPerDEDim1=ims, countsPerDEDim2=jms, rc=status\)
VERIFY\_\(STATUS\)

GCS = ESMF\_GridCompCreate\(vm, NAME='advCore', configFile=configFile, &
& grid=grid, petList=petList, RC=STATUS\)
VERIFY\_\(STATUS\)

where n = NX \* NY and petList is an array containing the "n" PEs.

Could you tell me if there is anything else I need to setup \(for the child VM\) so that numPEs \(see above\) is "n" \(but not "n+1"\)?

Thank you in advance for your help.

Cheers,

Jules

\-- -------------------------------------------------------------------------
Jules Kouatchou, PhD
Advanced Management Technology, Inc. | Tel: 301-286-6059
NASA GSFC - Code 610.3 | Fax: 301-286-1775
Greenbelt, MD 20771 | Jules.Kouatchou-1@.nasa.gov
\-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Life is good\! It depends on how you perceive events unfolding around you. -------------------------------------------------------------------------

From: Dani Bundy

Cecelia,

I'm working with Brian Eaton to run a recent development version of CAM 
\(cam3\_5\_43\) using the ESMF libraries.   We started 
with ESMF version 3, but we don't want to change the existing CAM interfaces to 
the libraries since we often use a fortran implementation of the routines 
from WRF. 

So now I'm trying to build ESMF 2.2.2. Brian successfully installed a 
beta version 2.2.2 but I've just had problem after problem with building 
the libraries-- actually, with linking-- \(even with version 3\). If you 
have someone who could come sit with me for an hour or so to try to get it 
working, that would help a lot.  Or even to talk with someone over the 
phone.

I'm trying to install on a linux cluster \(CGD's bangkok\), where it 
builds okay but the checks fail with a linking error. 

The build was also successful on bluevista but I haven't yet figured 
out how to make the tests use lsf instead of Load Leveler so I don't know 
if the link is working or not.

Thanks very much for any help you can offer. 

Dani

tickets.description:
WHO: Craig D. "Ghee" Fry from Exploration Physics International, Inc. \(EXPI\)



Hi Sylvia or ESMF Support team,

Can you point me to more info on the ESMF coupler Cecelia mentioned below?  Is this a canned coupler we should be considering for our projects?  

Vince Eccles and I are in the process of writing a stub coupler and then a functional coupler for BEI-03 HAF-GAIM coupling.  We have decided we need the HAF export state \(4x4x4xN arrays of solar wind speed, density, magnetic field at times t=0-N\) passed to GAIM as its import state \(1xN arrays of the same solar wind parameters interpolated at a fixed point in the center of the HAF 4x4x4 arrays\).   Can you recommend a particular sample ESMF coupler implementation that will serve as an example for us?  We can figure out the interpolation part.  It's the coupling part that we don't want to be spinning our wheels.

Ghee


Dr. Craig D. "Ghee" Fry, President
Exploration Physics International, Inc. \(EXPI\)
6275 University Dr. NW, Suite 37-105
Huntsville, AL 35806-1776
Tel: 256-971-4080, gfry@expi.com


Hi all,

Fei Liu and other members of the ESMF team have been
collaborating with Community Climate System Model
\(CCSM\) staff to develop an ESMF-based coupler, ESMCpl.
If you'd like to receive updates on the ESMCpl, or are
interested in participating in its development, please write
esmf\_support@ucar.edu and let us know.

Best,
Cecelia

posts.text:
Logged In: YES 
user\_id=340034
Originator: NO

This turned out to be a configuration issue with LIS 5.0. Chris had previously tried to build LIS 5.0 against a more recent version of ESMF. For some reason the LIS build could not be convinced by Chris to not look at this newer version of ESMF in later build attempts. This resulted in a very inconsistent situation with ESMF 2.2.2rp3 confliciting with the more recent ESMF version he had tried previously. Anyway, the ESMF 2.2.2rp3 build turned out to be complete on his system and after he downloaded a fresh copy of LIS 5.0 he was able to build against his ESMF 2.2.2rp3 installation successfully\! :-\)
\*gjt\*

NCEP isn't using halo bounds to delineate the region of their memory that is valid data, so when they start doiong communication it will cause problems for them.

WHO: Samuel Zehel from the California University of Pennsylvania


Is it possible to run either MM5, or WRF on ESMF using a Hewlett Packard/Red Hat Enterprise 5 GNU/Linux machine already running LDM?
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_
From: Tom Yoksas \[yoksas@unidata.ucar.edu\]

To: Zehel, Samuel
Cc: Tom Yoksas; Kauffman, Chad; Staffen, William
Subject: 20090305: FW: \[nws-changes\] 20090226: NGM model removal-\[Fwd: ADMIN NOTICE NOUS42 KWNO\] \(cont.\)

Hi Samuel,

re:
I've noticed that NCAR uses the ESMF \(Earth System Modeling Framework\) to
generate WRF, would it be possible for CUP to run WRF on our equipment here
using ESMF.

Yes, it should be.  You should contact the ESMF folks for authoritative
information, however.

Would it be possible to run the MM5 model on ESMF instead?

I imagine so, but why would you want to when the community has
transitioned from MM5 to WRF?

Cheers,

Tom

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_
From: Tom Yoksas \[yoksas@unidata.ucar.edu\]
Sent: Saturday, February 28, 2009 12:47 PM
To: Zehel, Samuel
Cc: Tom Yoksas
Subject: 20090227: FW: \[nws-changes\] 20090226: NGM model removal-\[Fwd: ADMI=
N NOTICE NOUS42 KWNO\] \(cont.\)

Hi Samuel,

re: cessation of NGM model data
I'm glad it won't affect McIDAS adversely.

At the time the McIDAS Learning Guide and Workshop materials were
written the NGM was an active and popular model.  Since then, its use
has been less and less as the newer mesoscale models like the ETA got
better and better. The Weather Service has continued to provide the NGM
data for continuity and to give users some time to convert over to use
of the ETA and now WRF.  Eliminating the NGM model data from the
operational NOAAPort broadcast was, quite frankly, long overdue.

Is there a way to run the NGM model locally?

I would imagine that one could, but it would make a LOT more sense to
implement the WRF.

P.S. I'm glad to be a reminder.

Again, I really appreciate your reminders and input\!

Cheers,

Tom

tickets.description:
WHO: Sujay Kumar, LIS/GSFC/NASA

Hi Cecelia, 
Thanks for these slides. In fact, Shujia and I had discussed this as an option sometime back. 

Currently the LIS-WRF coupling is implemented without breaking the run loop. WRF writes the export ESMF state to one of the I/O streams, and then the coupler reads them and LIS executes. The system works fine for a single domain. One issue that we are struggling with is to extend this to support a nested configuration of WRF \(with concurrent nests running\) -- We then would have export states defined for each nest. Currently the WRF I/O to ESMF translator can not handle this requirement. From what I understand, the direct coupling will not solve this issue either. 

In any case, this is good to know because it avoids the need for the code to bubble back up to to the top level, right? 
-S

On Apr 6, 2010, at 1:36 PM, Cecelia DeLuca wrote:

> Hi Christa,
>
> Gerhard Theurich implemented the direct coupling approach.  There is
> a slide deck on it at:
> http://www.earthsystemmodeling.org/presentations/pres\_0804\_directcoupling.pdf
> and Gerhard can point you to a system test.  I think Sujay may have
> already had
> a little exposure to it already.
>
> I would encourage you to include Gerhard in discussion, since he can help
> explain the capability, and can also comment on how it could potentially
> be modified if necessary.
>
> -- Cecelia
>
>
>
> -- 
> ===================================================================
> Cecelia DeLuca
> NESII/CIRES/NOAA Earth System Research Laboratory
> 325 Broadway, Boulder 80305-337
> Email: cecelia.deluca@noaa.gov
> Phone: 303-497-3604
>

\------------------------------------
Sujay Kumar, Ph.D
Code 614.3, SAIC/NASA GSFC
Greenbelt, MD 20771
Email: Sujay.V.Kumar@nasa.gov
Web:http://neptune.gsfc.nasa.gov/hsb/?skumar
Ph: 301-286-8663, Fax: 301-286-8624
\------------------------------------

posts.text:
There has been discussion with Sujay about this. An email was sent in May 2010 to John M. about this, too, but no response \(he was just in the process of leaving WRF at that time\). Leave this open and move to apps because the issue \(while it is not moving forward right now\) will probably come up again in the future.
\*gjt\*

tickets.description:
WHO: Mariana Vertenstein of CESM

Mariana and Jim Edwards expressed an interest in using our sparse matrix multiply. This ticket is to help them to use it. Part of this task is to make the method for reading weights from a SCRIP file public and to put an example of using it into the reference manual, the rest is to assist them with using it in their code.

WHO: Gerhard \(core team\) for Patrick Tripp and Raghu Reddy \(both EMC/UMIG/NEMS at NCEP\)

I installed the latest ESMF snapshot tag \(620bs21\) on Zeus with an associated module file I would like to share with the NEMS team. Using this ESMF installation I tested the current NEMS development HEAD version with NUOPC turned on, and find that some API changes need to be made to NEMS.
